title: Roscosmos head revises comments about quitting ISS after 2024
summary: The new head of Russia’s space agency backed away from comments suggesting Russia would withdraw from the International Space Station as soon as 2024 but expressed doubts Russia would be involved through 2030.

title: House appropriator discusses space priorities
summary: A key House member outlined his priorities for NASA and civil space activities that he says are necessary to compete in a new “space race” with China.

title: NASA, companies reject concerns over commercial space station development schedules
summary: Both NASA and the companies selected by the agency to begin development of commercial space stations say they don’t share concerns raised by watchdogs that such stations may not be ready by the time the International Space Station is retired.

title: NASA, ESA unveil advanced architecture for Mars Sample Return
summary: On July 27, NASA and the European Space Agency (ESA) unveiled new advanced mission architecture for the upcoming Mars Sample Return mission. Additionally, NASA completed its system requirements review for the mission, bringing the ambitious project one step closer to the completion of its conceptual design phase.

title: ESA scaling back design of X-ray astronomy mission
summary: Faced within increasing costs, the European Space Agency is looking for ways to revise the design of a large X-ray space telescope, an effort that could have implications for NASA’s own astrophysics programs.

title: Long March 5B rocket stage makes fiery uncontrolled reentry over Indian Ocean
summary: Wreckage from a Chinese Long March 5B rocket first stage made a fiery reentry into Earth’s atmosphere over Southeast Asia Saturday, six days after launching a space station module into orbit.

title: NASA Administrator Statement on Chinese Space Debris
SpaceX shares how it’s making Starlink satellites less bright.
summary: SpaceX shared how it’s making its Starlink satellites less bright. The space exploration company published a document titled, Brightness Mitigation Best Practices...

title: South Korean spacecraft fueled for ride from Cape Canaveral to the moon
summary: A South Korean spacecraft set for launch to the moon next week from Cape Canaveral has been loaded with the fuel it needs to maneuver into a low-altitude lunar orbit for image-taking and scientific observations.

title: Re-entry of large Chinese rocket booster spotted over Borneo
summary: The 22-ton core stage of a Chinese rocket fell back to Earth Saturday, the third time in two years China has allowed such a large booster to re-enter the atmosphere uncontrolled. There were no immediate reports of wreckage or damage on the ground. Space debris experts said the unguided re-entry posed a low but avoidable risk to the world’s population.
